alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:20PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Talladega and northwestern Coosa Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 520 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Talladega Springs, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sylacauga, Talladega Springs, Weogufka, Fayetteville, Strickland Crossroads, Unity, Marble Valley, Lay Lake, Sylacauga Municipal Airport, Cedar Creek, Gantts Quarry, Varnons and Alabama 4H Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
